text:
e="preserve">Dudley Sutton (6 April 1933 – 15 September 2018) was an English actor. He was born in Kingston-upon-Thames, Surrey, England. He was known for his roles in "Rotten to the Core" (1965), "Crossplot" (1969), "The Devils" (1971), "Madame Sin" (1972), "The Pink Panther Strikes Again" (1976), "Fellini's Casanova" (1976), "Edward II" (1991), and "The Football Factory" (2004).
Sutton died of cancer on 15 September 2018 in London at the age of 85.
